newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt's Watany Bank ups 1996 profits.
newsitem.headline: Egypt's Watany Bank ups 1996 profits.

text.p: Watany Bank of Egypt has said it made 42.787 million pounds ($12.6 million) net profit in calendar 1996, against 30.795 million in the previous year.
The bank said it would pay out 31.8 million to shareholders, or 2.7 pounds per share. In 1995, the bank distributed 22.464 million pounds.
The bank decided at its general meeting earlier this week to amend its internal rules to pave the way for increasing the authorised capital to 315 million pounds from 105 million.
Brokers made the meeting details available to Reuters.
Overall deposits rose to 1.36 billion pounds in 1996 from 1.03 billion in the previous year, financial statements distributed during the meeting showed. The calender year ends on December 31.
Shareholders' funds went up to 145.133 milllion pounds from 85.567 million in 1995.
The bank's shares are of two types, pound shares with a nominal value of 7.00 pounds and dollar shares with a nominal value of $2.06.
The share last traded on the stock exchange at 52.85 pounds.
